word_mean: 天体表面单位时间辐射的总能量，即天体真正的发光能力。

sentence.Network_en: For a few years its luminosity flared up to about 10,000 times the present-day luminosity of the Sun.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的亮度有几年一度达到了现在太阳亮度的一万倍左右。

sentence.Network_en: Mount Battie without losing its definition would take on a blue luminosity.
sentence.Network_cn: 远处的巴蒂山沉浸在一派蓝茫茫的暮蔼之中,轮廓朦胧.

sentence.Network_en: Astronomers tacitly assume that stars of the same luminosity and color all have the same mass.
sentence.Network_cn: 天文学家心照不宣地默认,光度和颜色都相同的恒星具有相同的质量.

entry.def: The luminosity of a star or sun is how bright it is.

example.ex: For a few years its luminosity flared up to about 10,000 times the present-day luminosity of the Sun.
example.tran: 它的亮度有几年一度达到了现在太阳亮度的一万倍左右。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light;

sentences.sentence: "its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun"
